column4: hey, is there any chance i could use a windows driver via wine?
not really
A complete reinstall of what?
VLC
In synaptic, there's an option when you right-click on a package "Mark for reinstallation".
tried
What happened?
it reinstalled, then when i ran it, it still had almost no gui'
Almost no GUI?
want a screenshot?
Yeah, sure - put it in the pastebin.
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/d6775
That's about the same as I get from VLC when I just open it - it's just a very minimalist interface.
So unless it won't actually play music/movies for you (supported formats, I mean) I don't see it as a bug.
i'd like to be able to start a video over again without reopening it
It doesn't show a pause / FF /RW button when it's playing media?
no, thats the problem
sure, let me know if it fixes it
I'll check to see if anyone else has reported the same problem.
no good
uninstalled, restarted gnome, reinstalled, all works
I got your message - awesome!
